page.title: 13FLORA ON MARK MOOR
page.content: Grasses. some 35 species found, survive because grassland rarely ploughed damp conditions encourage vigorous growth. Flowering plants - meadowsweet, angelica & pepper saxifrage in grass left for hay. Shorter varieties - marsh pennywort & creeping jenny in grazing pastures. Kingcups flourish in wet places & wild teazels on grass verges. Waterplants grow vigorously in rhynes & have to be cleared at frequent intervals to allow the water to flow freely. Floating plants soon reappear to cover the surface. Rhyne edge plants grow thickly where undisturbed yellow iris, bullrushes, sedges & many other herbaceous plants are a glorious sight in summer. They provide cover for many species of insects & birds.
